com.github.i49.hibiscus.schema

Interface NumberType

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AtomicType, JsonType
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IntegerType
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IntegerTypeImpl, NumberTypeImpl

    public interface NumberType
extends AtomicType
    One of built-in types representing JSON number which has TypeId.NUMBER as a type identifier. This type represents a signed decimal number with or without a fractional part.

    An instance of this type can be created through SchemaComponents.number().

    
 import static com.github.i49.hibiscus.schema.SchemaComponents.*;
 NumberType t = number();

    Restrictions on this type

    This type allows you to impose following restrictions on the value space.

    1. minInclusive
    2. minExclusive
    3. maxInclusive
    4. maxExclusive
    5. enumeration
    6. assertion

    1. minInclusive

    minInclusive specifies the lower bound of the numeric range. The bound value is included in the valid range.

    number().minInclusive(42);

    2. minExclusive

    minExclusive specifies the lower bound of the numeric range. The bound value is excluded from the valid range.

    number().minExclusive(42);

    3. maxInclusive

    maxInclusive specifies the upper bound of the numeric range. The bound value is included in the valid range.

    number().maxInclusive(42);

    4. maxExclusive

    maxExclusive specifies the upper bound of the numeric range. The bound value is excluded from the valid range.

    number().maxExclusive(42);

    5. enumeration

    enumeration specifies the value space of this type as a set of distinct values.

    number().enumeration(1, 2, 3);

    6. assertion

    assertion allows you to make a arbitrary assertion on the values of this type.

    See Also:
    SchemaComponents

      • assertion

        NumberType assertion(Predicate<JsonNumber> predicate,
                     ProblemDescriber<JsonNumber> describer)
        Makes a assertion on the values of this type.
        Parameters:
        predicate - the lambda expression that will return true if the assertion succeeded or false if failed.
        describer - the object supplying the description of the problem to be reported when the assertion failed.
        Returns:
        this type.
        Throws:
        SchemaException - if any of specified parameters is null.
